item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/08/01/casting-google/#comment-4240">julien51</a>.
I'm not sure what to make of Google+ as a product. I created a few circles, added a few people to them, but never really used it much. One thing that did happen is I stopped used Picasa because the merge with Google+ made it too confusing to tell what was going to happen with my photos.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to julien51.

I’m not sure what to make of Google+ as a product. I created a few circles, added a few people to them, but never really used it much. One thing that did happen is I stopped used Picasa because the merge with Google+ made it too confusing to tell what was going to happen with my photos.

item.title: By: julien51
item.dc:creator: julien51
item.description:
If that's true (and I believe there is some truth to it), I'm astonished by Google's repeated failure at social... I'm also very surprised by the lack of vision. To this day, G+ is merely a copycat of what other social networks are (Facebook or Twitter)... rather than something new.
Finally, I have a thought for all this product that were killed by G+'s requirements in terms of development effort and growth relays: Gchat or Reader come to mind.
item.content:encoded:
If that’s true (and I believe there is some truth to it), I’m astonished by Google’s repeated failure at social… I’m also very surprised by the lack of vision. To this day, G+ is merely a copycat of what other social networks are (Facebook or Twitter)… rather than something new.

Finally, I have a thought for all this product that were killed by G+’s requirements in terms of development effort and growth relays: Gchat or Reader come to mind.
